Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/70.26.215.238|70.26.215.238]] ([[User talk:70.26.215.238|talk]]) to last version by 210.15.254.45
/* The Last Days of the National Constituent Assembly */ Added comma to subordinate clause and corrected apparent typographical error.
/* The last days of the National Constituent Assembly */ Edited capitalization for consistency,
/* From the Anniversary of the Bastille to the Death of Mirabeau */ Clarification to avoid ambiguous reference.
/* From the Anniversary of the Bastille to the Death of Mirabeau */ Coordinating conjunctions should be outside of elliptical construction (common error).
/* From the Anniversary of the Bastille to the Death of Mirabeau */ For readability, periods are preferred over semicolons.
/* From the Anniversary of the Bastille to the Death of Mirabeau */ Shorter sentences are more readable. Sentence should not start with a coordinating conjunction.
/* From the Anniversary of the Bastille to the Death of Mirabeau */ Added coordinating conjunction to end of list.
/* From the anniversary of the Bastille to the death of Mirabeau */ Edited capitalization for consistency.
/* The appearance of factions */ Edited capitalization for consistency.
/* The storming of the Bastille */ Edited capitalization for consistency.
/* Dechristianisation */ Used different preposition for clarity.
/* Dechristianisation */ Replaced semicolon with a period and reworded sentence to be more readable.
/* The abolition of feudalism */ edited capitalization for consistency.
/* The abolition of feudalism */ edited capitalization for consistency.
/* The abolition of feudalism */ edited capitalization for consistency.
/* Further reading */ cleaned up capitalization for consistency.
/* Further reading */ Alphabetized references and cleaned up citation format to be consistent with Harvard standard.
/* The storming of the Bastille */ Added pinpoint reference to Hibbert.
/* Further reading */ Added reference to Hibbert.
/* The storming of the Bastille */ Added details regarding the Great Fear.
/* The National Constituent Assembly */ To avoid a needlessly long sentence, the period is preferred over the semicolon (except for long lists).
/* The National Assembly */ Knowing when to use "that" is difficult. Its use should generally be limited to "disambiguation." When redundant, it should be eliminated for brevity.
/* The Estates-General of 1789 */ Better to start sentence with a subordinate modifier than with a coordinating conjunction.
/* Proto-Revolutionary Activity */ Where it can be used, comma is better use than semicolon for short subordinate clauses.
Use of indefinite articles for consistency. Articles not needed where sentence begins with a modifier (whether noun, adjective or adverb).
Comma was added to create proper elliptical construction. Auxiliary verb added and tenses corrected to create proper parallelism.
Where proper sentences can be formed, the use of the period is preferred over the semicolon. A comma was also added to make the subordination of clauses consistent for parallel sentence structure.
